issue.title: Using mlock() to avoid sensitive data being written to swap space
issue.body: I think it would be a good idea to use [mlock()](https://linux.die.net/man/2/mlock) for things like passwords, or loaded private keys, to avoid them being written to the swap space.

issue.title: Security: Fix side-channel vulnerability
issue.body:
(This is my first contribution working with C, so please check the code.)

Fix side-channel vulnerability in `symcrypt()` under `symops.c` by comparing passwords in constant time. Function to compare in constant time is taken from [cryptocoding.net](https://cryptocoding.net/index.php/Coding_rules).

issue.title: Fix calling munlock() on pass twice
issue.body: Probably was meant to be called on `pass2`.

issue.body: Probably was meant to be called on `pass2`.

issue.title: Using mlock() to avoid sensitive data being written to swap space
issue.body: I think it would be a good idea to use [mlock()](https://linux.die.net/man/2/mlock) for things like passwords, or loaded private keys, to avoid them being written to the swap space.

issue.title: Side-channel vulnerability
issue.body:
Right now there is a side-channel vulnerability in the `symcrypt()` function under `symops.c`. This is because the two passwords are being compared using `strcmp()` which is not in constant time. More about this problem can be read about in this [article](https://www.mwrinfosecurity.com/our-thinking/protecting-against-side-channel-attacks-at-the-application-layer/). 

PR #2 should fix this.

issue.title: Add option for choosing the number of threads used by argon2
issue.body:
It's my suggestion, because most processors today have 4 threads or more, mine has 8.

I made a lammer-ish hack in the ./include/defines.h file and worked fine.

#define	ARGON2_T	4000	/* Number of default iterations */
#define ARGON2_MEM	32	/* Default RAM used in MiB */
#define ARGON2_P	 8	/* Default number of threads */
#define MIN_ROUNDS      2000	/* Minimum iterations */
#define MAX_ROUNDS      6000	/* Maximum iterations */
#define	MIN_MEM		16	/* Minimum RAM in MiB */
#define	MAX_MEM		64	/* Maximum RAM in MiB */
